subject_terms_3: 1942-1945 Japanese occupation Searle, Ronald, 1920-2011 Changi Prison
context_2: world wars occupations (armed conflicts) plays (performing arts compositions)
physical_appearance: This is a souvenir programme. It ocnsists of two sheets of paper. On the left of the top sheet, there is an multicolored illustration of three women. The title is inscribed in black against a coloured background. The programme is printed in blue ink on the second sheet of paper. The programme is slightly stained, and folded at the edges.
sgcool_label_text: "Prisoners in the Changi P.O.W camp kept their spirits up and their minds occupied by putting on shows. The souvenir programme for ""Cinderella and the Magic Soya Bean. A Burlesque pantomime by Alan Roberts"" [with scenes and costumes designed by Ronald Searle] is an example of one such show. The programme includes 3 pages of typescript
